member.name: M:Rephidock.GeneralUtilities.MoreMath.TabShift(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: For a given 0-based column position of a tab character ('\t') returns a column position for the next character.

summary.para: Returns the value mod modulo. Keep in mind that % is the remainder operation. The result of mod is never negative, as opposed to remainder.

member.name: M:Rephidock.GeneralUtilities.MoreMath.Wrap(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Wraps value into given range: values below the range are wraped into it from the end and values above are wraped into it from the start
Can be thought of as a generilized version of TrueMod, as x.Wrap(0, y) returns the same result as x.TrueMod(y)

member.param: The start of the range, inclusive
The end of the range, exclusive
member.remarks: If is greater than , the values are swapped. If and are equal, is returned.
member.returns: The value wrapped to be inside the range

member.name: M:Rephidock.GeneralUtilities.MoreMath.DigitalRoot(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the digital root of a number. Digital root is calculated by taking the sum of all of the number's digits, and then that sum, until the result is a single digit.
member.exception: is negative or is smaller than 2

member.name: M:Rephidock.GeneralUtilities.MoreMath.GetFactors(System.Int32)

summary.para: Returns all integer factors of the number in accending order.
If is 0, 0 is returned. If is 1, 1 is returned. If is negative, -1 is returned, followed by factors of abs(n)

member.param: The value to return factors of

member.summary: A collection of index pairs, where key is the old index and value is the new index. Can be used for tracking where the items ended up.
member.remarks: Is an abstraction over a shuffled array of indexes.

member.summary: An array which translates old indexes to new indexes

member.name: M:Rephidock.GeneralUtilities.ReflectionExtensions.IsSubcalssOrSelfOf(System.Type,System.Type)

summary.para: Returns true if the given is or a subclass of it.
Also supports generic type definitions. Does not support interfaces. (netframework3.5) Does not support enums.

member.remarks: For array types return true only on type equality.
member.exception: is an interface or (netframework35) is an enum
